metadata.title: CVE-2014-2383 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
dompdf.php in dompdf before 0.6.1, when DOMPDF_ENABLE_PHP is enabled,allows context-dependent attackers to bypass chroot protections and readarbitrary files via a PHP protocol and wrappers in the input_fileparameter, as demonstrated by aphp://filter/read=convert.base64-encode/resource in the input_fileparameter.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-2383` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

php-dompdf - 0.6.1+dfsg-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: php-dompdf package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.6.1+dfsg-2').
